Reviews.Title: “IT'S A 3 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayGoofs
Reviews.Content: They did the IMPRTANT thing right. CLEAN rooms, FAST check-in and check-out and OK prices. Fifteen $$ per day for parking if fair. Street noise is a bit high. Otherwise, very satified with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: a b
Reviews.Content: Lucie @ the front desk was wonderful and so thoughtful... The manager was very helpful and friendly... Best check in Montreal yet :) will come back for another visit

Reviews.Title: “Some good points but disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: southernstar66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of April. We felt that the hotel was quite shabby and needed some updating. The staff at the desk were friendly and polite. Our room was okay although it wasnt what we were expecting. The spa is not as you imagine and downstairs under the main floor was very drab. The lobby was nicely decorated but the rest of the hotel did not reflect the same standard. The good points were that when we were disappointed that there was no tea facilitiy the hotel offered us a microwave which we were grateful for. Another downside was that the breakfast facilities were extremely overpriced and although you pay for service it is a self service which is very very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but for a reason”
Reviews.Author: karpa22
Reviews.Content: This hotel does has some positives; we were able to get a room very cheap on Priceline, the front-desk staff are friendly, and the location is decent. The bathroom was very clean and nicely tiled, it was what you'd expect of a four-star hotel. Overall, however, this hotel was disappointing, and not up to standards expected of a three-star hotel. There was a bar of soap on the hallway floor right outside our room when we arrived â€” not a great sign. The furniture had stains and the bedding and furniture had cigarette burns (strange, given that the hotel is non-smoking). Pillows were of disappointing quality, the thermostat didn't work, the radiator was dented, lamp shades had holes in them and were covered in dust, the TV remote didn't work properly and the curtains didn't close in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNA-MN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my wife and two small kids (2 and 8). I booked this hotel through priceline. As soon as the booking was confirmed, almost 6 weeks prior to our arrival in Montreal, I contacted the hotel via e-mail and requested them for a non-smoking room for us. I got a response mentioning that it will cost $20 more for a non-smoking room as I booked the hotel through priceline. Although I was unhappy (because I never paid extra at any hotel whenever I booked via priceline in different countries), I agreed to pay extra because I don't want my young kids to get exposed to cigarette smoke. I requested them to charge me this extra amount and reserve a non-smoking room. However, when we arrived at the hotel, the clerk at the front desk said that they don't have a non-smoking room available and that the hotel was full. I mentioned about my e-mail communication that took place weeks before. Hotel manager on duty made me look into my e-mail (in the hotel computer in the common area) to prove that my e-mail did communication did occur, and I am telling the truth. When I showed the e-mail printout, she said 'sorry' but since the hotel was full they cannot give a non-smoking room. Clearly the hotel staff did not honor my request. We spent that night in a smoking room that was disgusting. Horrible smell, torn sheets and sofa (I included a picture). None of us could sleep that night. Luckily, a non-smoking room became available next morning and we shifted there by paying $20 per night for the remaining two nights. Hotel is very old, and in bad shape. It is close to St. Catherine's but it is a good 10-15 min walk. When we went to have a breakfast one morning, there was nobody there. Overall, we had a very bad experience. Stay away from this hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Would never pay full price”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel007
Reviews.Content: I came on business and got a good rate but would never pay the price of full cost here, not worth it. The Hotel has passed its day and in need of bad upgrading. It's at least 50 years older or more. The rooms are spacious but older TV's, some stains on drapes. Bathroom is nicely tiled though. It is close to St.Catherine Street but way on the other end so shopping is a good walk. Nothing really for amentities and your looking at at least $15 a day for parking. Doubtful i would stay again unless they upgrade, too many other hotels to choose from in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: PatD0606
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's in excellent proximity with St. Catherine Street, and not too far away from the Bell Centre as well. Everything else was just OK, at best. Rooms weren't the cleanest, the phones didn't work, the restaurant was over-price, and lacked service, and the pool was no longer in service. If you're looking for a hotel that's fairly cheap, and is in a good location, then this is good. Anything else, and you'll be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: My employer put me up at Le Nouvel for 1 month while looking for an Apt. I stayed in one of their condos. The service was extremely friendly and helpful, the room was so clean and the location in downtown Montreal was amazing! They have a restaurant on site and computers in the lobby for your convenience. I loved that they had an ATM in the lobby as well as a convenience store. I even had a washer and dryer with a full kitchen in suite! I was there a month and they wanted to clean my room everyday! I would absolutely recommend Le Nouvel to anyone coming to Montreal for a vaca or as a long term option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service was ok”
Reviews.Author: imad_kaddouh
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, one or 2 blocks away from st-catherine and not too far from the Bell Centre. Check in was swift and easy, the room we booked was great, very large and clean. Had a bit of a hickup at the restaurant paying the bill which was a bit annoying but was dealt with as quickly as possible. Did not experince any problems with the exception of some annoying guests ( nothing you can blame on the hotel). This is my 3rd time at this place Book and enjoy, the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Clarissa S
Reviews.Content: We stayed and held a training conference at the hotel and found the staff professional and helpful. We will be returning again for another conference in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there. Had to wait fifteen minutes for our room. The room was clean. The bed comfortable. It was a little far from where we wanted to go but close to the main strip, with many restaurants, bars, and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nana M
Reviews.Content: Had a great experiecence, employes are very profesional and always ready to help specialy the house keeping service. I recommended and I will return for sure,

Reviews.Title: “Once only”
Reviews.Author: bin_there2
Reviews.Content: I stayed and wont return to this hotel, I have been employed by other hotel chains with "much" higher standards but thought I would try this hotel after listening to what the gentleman told me about the room when I first booked it directly with Le Nouvel. Most important part of a room is the mattresss and whan I lifted the sheets to see the condition there were a few stains ok, but the banana shaped mattress is not acceptable. I like a second pillow always, found one in the dresser pulled the pillow case off that hid the numerous perspiration stains and could feel my two fingers pinching it together, it was "THAT " thin!! The next morning I went down for the hot and cold buffet that I was told about only to find they didnt offer that, only the cold buffet for $9.95 which didnt look very good or plentiful at all. I checked out and told the front desk of my stay, a very courteous and understanding man helped me and apologized and told me that the general manager would call me never happened, I called the manager a week later out of courtesy before writing this review to let him know my thoughts and give him a chance to explain.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy - can't sleep - Doesn't worth it”
Reviews.Author: cedric666
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location however don't expect to sleep before 2 am! We stayed friday and saturday night and the hotel was having big party on ballrooms few floors below us. The walls were almost shaking. Called the lobby and they said it was usual this time of the year!!! The room was ok but the we couldn't really have a good temperature in it. Cold air was coming through the window. The spa is a joke, so the fitness center. They're located two floors below the lobby and the same level where you park your car. Hard to relax when you heard and smell the parking lot... This hotel doesn't worth it. There's plenty of other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Average location, better choices out there”
Reviews.Author: Benton Y
Reviews.Content: They recently renovated the lobby and concierge area so don't let that fool you to thinking the rooms are just as nice. The rooms and hallways need a major update, for a big city like Montreal this is not what I would expect from even a 3* hotel. Walls are paper thin, and carpets look old and more stained than old las vegas. Surprisingly they spend their money on Neutrogena toiletries, and nothing else. Ice machine/vending machines only in lobby. The only positives is that they offer free wi-fi, and the staff that I encountered were all very friendly and courteous. The bathroom was well cleaned for what it is. Parking is $15, and the location isn't the greatest. The immediate area around the hotel is pretty seedy, and you have to walk about 15 minutes to get to the heart of the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, needs better cleaning”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last weekend for one night. The hotel has a nice location, near to the Eaton Shopping Mall and not too far from old town Montreal. It has a nice lobby and helpful staff. The rooms are large. only complain that we have is that the room floor wasn't very clean. The white socks turn to gray just after couple steps. Otherwise, it was an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quality/price tops!!”
Reviews.Author: mullowney1126
Reviews.Content: an hotel in the core of the downtown that doesn't break the bank and has 'all' that you need...a short walk to ste catherine st west (< 5min.) and 15 min to the rest of the core.. our queen room was simply fine, well furnished and modern... the price was excellent for a downtown hotel... service is a touch 'sketchy' and corridors are a little run-down, but overall, a fine quality/price ratio... it has become our place to stay in the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean but tired looking.”
Reviews.Author: Kat44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. It is a 10/15 minute walk from the downtown shopping area. We were travelling with a 6 month old baby and when we arrived the staff were kind enough to upgrade us to a room with a fridge. The room was large and clean but it was looking a bit tired. There was a hole in the sofa, paint scuffed off walls and the bed was quite creaky and lumpy. It was a decent enough hotel for the price we paid in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Golgo8
Reviews.Content: A perfect location and price for a weekend away. You will love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3-star hotel, good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Catitude
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline through the "name your price" option. We paid less than $100/night - wifi was included in the room and was functional fo both days of our stay, parking was $15/day. All staff were helpful and courteous - they assisted in booking a coach tour for my mother just a few hours prior to her scheduled pick-up time at the hotel for a rate comparable to what was available online. For a 3-star we didn't have high expectations - the room was clean, bathroom was a little small, and most items in the room were dated but sufficient for our needs. The hotel was located in a fairly central location downtown so we were a brief cab ride or drive to all downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “very rude unhelpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: lowflyingcat
Reviews.Content: we arrived after a long journey to find they didn't have a room ready for us, so we sat and sat and sat a bit more until eventual a room was found. again we were given no direction to the room apart from being waved to the lift. We had booked a twin bedded room and what we got was a king and a pull out bed which was very uncomfortable. In our bathroom the hair dryer was missing and when i called the front desk to tell them it was missing and that as two ladies we needed one, the attitude was again unhelpful and i was told " we don't have a spare" i refused to accept this and demanded a hairdryer, which is surely standard in any hotel room, eventually after 8 hours a hair dryer did appear with no even an apology. The king bed we had to share because of the pull out bed was as hard as rocks and we only had one pillow each, it was the worst nights sleeps either of us had on our trip. Would never stay here again mainly down to the rudeness of the staff and the uncomfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to The Fun of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Charlie K
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well maintained hotel.....Only a few blocks from Crescent Street/St. Catherine Street/and Bell Centre. Very affordable. Only negatives are restaurant and Wi-Fi

Reviews.Title: “Well below standard”
Reviews.Author: acdmc
Reviews.Content: Went on a Newmarket Touring holiday and stayed in this hotel 16-18th Oct 2011. After a long day travelling we did not expect to find the bedding appeared not to have been changed. Hairs etc on the pillows and sheets.The bathroom had several broken tiles around the sink and the appearance was generally grubby at best. An extra pillow in a drawer had a stain the size of a dinner plate. After complaining to the desk someone came appx 45mins later,viewed the sheets,pillows etc and left. After appx 35mins he and a lady came and changed ALL the bedding. We finally got to bed at about 1am. Our floor had a sign saying "executive floor" whatever that means and we also heard that several other couples had similar experiences re the cleanliness of this place.The hotel was "tired" outdated and looks to be run on a shoestring. Given our initial experience we did not use the restaurant or the spa. The local area lacks any supermarkets or decent restaurants so you need to walk or eat prior to getting back to the hotel. Would not recommend to anyone or wish to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: misty L
Reviews.Content: It does have a good location off of the 720, and close enough to St. Catherines. At check-in you must pay for your entire stay, along with a deposit for the room as well as a deposit to use the phone. I got the feeling that they were very worried that I would skip out on my bill, I haven't encountered this at any other hotel I've stayed in, so I was very offended. I told the man at the front desk, who quickly apologized and then spoke to the man next to him, who was quick to say, oh thats standard, that's what we do. I had a king corner room on the 2nd floor, it was spacious though the placement of the mirrors around the bed was a bit unsettling. The couch cushions were sliding around, difficult to be comfortable without the seat cushion taking off from under you. Then I questioned the cleanliness of the couch, and put a blanket down on it before sitting with my pj's on. The TV was old and had lots of "snow", static. I turned the TV to see from the bed, and this only made it worse. I looked at the wiring thinking I had disconnected, and found that there was only 1 bare wire attaching the cable to the TV. The bathroom was clean, though the shelf above the sink appeared to have fallen off & was now held up by two crooked screws, so my toiletries kept falling off this shelf. There are very few plug ins to charge phones, cameras etc. So I ended up unplugging some lights to charge my phones. I called to order room service at 9:45 and was told that it was "too late" the chef did not want to stay late, although the menu says room service is until 10pm. The conference room was a good size, though the food they provided was minimal, small portions. One night, our conference room was not cleaned, and we ended up clearing our tables ourselves and had to request coffee and refreshments, which then arrived about 30-45 minutes later. Upon check-out, I was told that my room would need to be "checked" by housekeeping before my room deposit would be returned to me. Again, I've never encountered this at any other hotel. The Wi-Fi was fine, though I could not access it after check-out, even though I was still in my conference room this day?? all very confusing for me. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EveryFiftee”
Reviews.Author: JPC1628
Reviews.Content: I could not find anything wrong with this hotel. Clean pleasant room (8th floor, which is perhaps better than others), well appointed (sofa, desk, safe), furniture did not show age at all, good sleep inducing bed and very quiet. Wi-fi works fine. The breakfast room (no room service under $10) is a good walk away, and unremarkably average. Front desk at times understaffed, with line-up. You can walk there from the station: you just keep on the same side of Bd RenÃ©-LÃ©vesque when you emerge from underground and turn left (west). Fifteen minutes. Or bus. There is a taxi stand across the street firm the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go anywhere else! 2 star at best...”
Reviews.Author: No_poor_service
Reviews.Content: I am not a fancy hotel snob. I am a Holiday Inn type of person. I used Priceline to get a room and it assigned me to this dump. No way would this be a 4 star hotel. The room is large... but that is it. The bed is as hard as a rock. The couch in the room has holes in it. The pillows are flat as pancakes. The bathroom towels are old and ratty with the side all frayed. They are so thin you can se through parts of them. The room is very loud and the constent honking and police sirens make it hard to sleep. I was told they have no other rooms which is probably true since they have every tour bus dropping people off here. Free internet is a lie. Said weak connection and they told me that it doesnt work in all rooms. So I can use their computers in the lobby if I want internet. Well that is where I am writing their review... right now in their lobby. I called the front desk and after the picked up and asked me to hold, I waited for 15+ min and just came downstairs to the lobby instead. The turned my room key off early and caused my items to be "stuck" in their hotel safe... no apologies at all. So rude staff, loud uncomfortable stinky ratty rooms, expensive parking, everything is a long walk, Highly DO NOT RECOMMEND. The only way they stay in business is probably because of Priceline and Tour bus's. No one would pick this dump on their own...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: chesterimp
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, this was ok - reception area belied the age/condition of the rooms and lobbies, but the rooms were clean, and the usual good size. good location - just off an exit from the autoroute from the airport, and close to downtown; old town/port os about 30mins walk, or use the underground. Street is tidy but characterless if you use it to walk into downtown/old town. a block 'north' is Rue St Catherines which is the main shopping street, also plenty of restaurants and on Rues Guy - Crescent which link the two. Front desk staff were good, and quick to send up more coffee when we asked (no hotel had enough in the room!). All in all, perfectly adequate, needs refurbishment though.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitravellings
Reviews.Content: Old, smelly hotel which is way past its use by date. Will never stay there again. Holes in blanket on bed, thin raggedy towels.Waitress at breakfast said they had no time to heat a croissant not even in the microwave as the chef was busy using it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old but Nice, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jaguarjg1
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews on here and was worried what I might find. Those worries were unfounded. While I will admit that the style of the room was dated. It reminded me of my parents bedroom, e.g., pulled back, heavy drapes with sheeres, dark wood furniture,large headboard, an older style tv, and even a brass and glass table with fake flowers. I can not vouch for all the rooms but mine was quite large. The biggest problem I had was that my room keys kept demagnitizing. It was annoying but the front desk was quick to help fix the problem. If fact I found the to be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: YvonneCarloe
Reviews.Content: The front desk agents make you feel welcome and are very helpful. We've also encountered other hotel staff who were equally welcoming and helpful. A staff member spotted our confusion and offered to help us find the ice machines. The sign indicating the location of the ice machines was not updated and we were on the wrong floor. The elevator was quite slow and even slower at check out time so I suggested taking the stairs. A staff member came to our rescue and helped us find the stairwell in the underground parking. The rooms may need some updating but they are clean. It would have been fairly quiet too if not for some inebriated guests arriving at 3 am who didn't realize how loud and lenghty their conversation was in the hallway. The price was reasonable especially for downtown Montreal. It is a slight walk to the metro (10 to 15 min. approx.) and close to the Molson Centre (15 to 20 min. approx.).

Reviews.Title: “A block away from the city center”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: We tried a cheaper hotel in Montreal and weren't dissapointed. The hotel isn't upclass or modern but offers a good bed and nice rooms. There is some wear and tear on the interior of the hotelroom but nothing serious. We had quite a large corner room, unfortunalty no king beds were available. There is self parking available for a fee. Wifi is free throughout the hotel. Bathroom was in very good shape unfortunalty the water pressure was a bit low. Staff was friendly. The staff speaks french and english. Didn't use any of the facilities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MLF65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with our 5 year old. Had King room. Lots of space, furniture was a little dated, but very clean. Had fridge and microwave in room. Cleaning staff were very good and friendly. Excellent service from front desk staff, especially from Alex and Alah. They were great with our 5 year old. Pool leaves a little to be desired as it is shared with the condo as well and is very small. Would definitely stay here again. Great location and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel during Fantasia!”
Reviews.Author: StarryEyed71
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Conveniently located just blocks from Concordia Uni. and the hot corners of Crescent st. Added bonus was that it was literally 5 mins off of the hwy 401. Sweet pool too. The only thing was the air was wonky so we changed rooms in 2 mins. No problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit bothered...”
Reviews.Author: Kevinklo
Reviews.Content: Just a few things.... 1. They get the booking wrong... Ok they fix that 2. They don't tell you anywhere on their site that its only wired internet in the condo suites... Yes casually they offer to downgrade me to a standard suite with wireless but this is not what I wanted or ordered. How or will they refund the difference since I booked through expedia? 3. Not even a bread knife in the kitchenette, let alone anything to cut a tomato with? 4. Wet behind the sofa due to a/c leak but they don't tell u about it, just leave the sofa's pulled forward and my daughter discovers it. 5. 3 coffee mugs, funny number that with 4 plates etc. Will need to make sure they don't charge me for the 4th... Really I now understand all those negative reviews as I sap my 3G without wireless... Just a bit upset they isn't seem bothered by it after actually giving me the wireless code... Oh yes I can go down to the lobby and use it..... I can see how

Reviews.Title: “central to everything”
Reviews.Author: poppy155004
Reviews.Content: This is a very good small hotel, that is located close todowntown Montreal and all the attractions. well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms, but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Tony1Ann
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night with 3 other couples. On arrival only one of the rooms was ready. Fortunately since these rooms are large we were all able to go to that room to await our rooms. And boy did we wait. Since we had all arrived after the scheduled check-in time and were one party wanting 4 rooms we would have expected them to all be ready at the same time. The staff wee pleasant enough though. The rooms were large, more like apartments witht he kitchen area. No view and the room, as is the rest of the hotel, is very dated and need of some refurbishment. Fairly good location, near metro Breakfast is very expensive for what you get and when we arrived most things had run out and we had to wait. Not much choice. The underground parking was very dirty, badly lit and seedy so much so that the men never let the women venture down there

Reviews.Title: “Condos were great”
Reviews.Author: amcghie
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous after reading some negatives but on our firsr phone call we felt that the "Condos" were the way to go. They were just a few dollars more than standard rooms but a world apart. The suite was HUGE. King bed, sleeper sofa, mini kitchen and dining area was great. Front desk staff was very nice as well as efficient. The parking was underground and somewhat seedy looking but was actually secure. Restaurant on premisis was excellent.' We did not see the standard rooms but the hotel was completely full during our stay and several flight crews from major airlins were using this hotel. The location was in avery nice section of town and the desk arranged our city tour with pick up at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ohung
Reviews.Content: Our unit has everything we need, including free internet access. We also love the location because it is close to major shopping area and Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Expect what you pay for, low quality 3*”
Reviews.Author: Cal560
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week for a 5 day business trip, the Intercontinental was full and this is as close to our office as we can stay. Previous comments have suggested the photos used in the hotel promotional materials are not accurate. I work in marketing and this is true. The professional shots used are very well lit and do not reflect the rooms/reception area as it is now. My room was not ready at check in so I thought I would go to the bar. I could not even bring myself to enter the bar, the hallway and dining room/bar smelled so bad - think chip fat - I did not want it to get into my clothes so I decided to head to the reception area and wait....and wait....and wait. Eventually I was given my key but had to take 3 bags up to my room myself....no help offered. Room was very big, 11th floor. No view. I agree with the other posts, the hotel is seriously old and the furnishings whist clean in my room were very old and worn. The air conditioning unit was very loud and woke me up several times during the night for the first two nights so I switched it off for the remainder of my trip. The staff are pleasant enough. Just note, you have to compromise on something to get a room that cheap in the great location this hotel is in. It appears with this hotel that the compromise is the age of the fixtures and fittings. This is a 3* hotel for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time and will return”
Reviews.Author: TainoDancer
Reviews.Content: I was concerned with previous reports that I read but once we arrived we were at ease. We had 3 rooms and all 3 rooms were clean and in good condition. You can see some wear on the furniture. And yes the TV set is not a flat screen but this is something that they are not hiding since you can see it on there website pictures. Marie and Alex were exceptional in the service they provided at the front desk. Always smiling, polite and perfect English. Housekeeping staff was also friendly and provided good service. We found the location to be ideal. Close enough to public transportation or walking (25 minutes) from the center of the city. Easy access to 747 express bus from the airport...drop off one block from the hotel. And just 3 blocks to the stop to get back to the airport. This was a huge savings. We love Montreal not only for everything they offer but also the cooler weather then what we have in Puerto Rico in the summer. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!!! Don't go there EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: zielkin
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife for one night and I'm so glad that was only one!!! Staff at the reception very unpleasant and bearly speaking english!!! We have our reservation for king bed, but by mistake thay gave it to somebody else and we end up with smelly and dirty twin room!!! I won't recommended to stay in this hotel to anybody!!! There is so many other, much better hotels in the town!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Old and Decayed"”
Reviews.Author: Remo06
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels.com, the rooms are nothing like what you see in the picture! The rooms are very old and decayed. The carpet had so much dirt and bathroom had all kinds of problems you can possibly have. There was a huge pillar in the middle of the room and the AC kept making loud noise. On top of all this, the bed made very loud (KEECHH) noise every time I tossed and turned. Initially I had booked this hotel for 3 nights with out releasing what I was getting into.. Then I decided to check out the next morning. The guy at the reception asked me the reason for early check out, I had told him couple of reasons, then he told me that I will not get any refund because I booked through hotels.com, he was ready to offer me different room too. But I wanted to get out of that place badly, then I Spoke to the manager, She asked me the reason.. Same story again! Then she was kind enough to tell me that she will only charge me for one night and refund the rest to hotels.com and I need to work with them to get the refund. I had called hotels.com and they told me that they have processed my refund, but I haven't gotten anything yet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, well designed, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: eugene_o
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in the hotel. I got it by bidding online, so I did not know the hotel name until I won it and I paid a very discounted rate. The room and lobby were very well designed and spotless. The room was large and comfortable. Unfortunately, I was able to get WiFi signal only next to the door. The hotel tries too hard to pretend to be fancier than it is. The restaurant is in the next building, although connected by a walkway. The swimming pool is actually in the apartment building next door and is very hard to find. The "spa" means a massage room hidden somewhere in the basement. The hotel seems to be catering to groups like sports teams. The hotel is in a central convenient location. The area immediately around the hotel has many office buildings and empty lots and is a bit dead at night, but it did not feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “We love it”
Reviews.Author: Superagent84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days during the F1 race. The room was wonderful - large and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The hotel was about 3 blocks from the Metro and a very easy walk. We would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline booking treated as second class citizens. Never going back .”
Reviews.Author: Travel_2011_world
Reviews.Content: My title of this review says all. I stayed there for three nights from June 10-13. My room didn't have Internet at all ( forget about the wireless). The front desk told me they don' t have Internet connection in their condo section of hotel. You cannot open window as this room windows open on railway tracks. The big surprise came right after 10 minutes checking in. The front desk supervisor (her name starts with w) to pay $40 + $10 plus taxes per night for my 5 year old daughter as they charge extra for kids. When I tried to negotiate with her not inky she was rude she sounded she doesn't care about the guest and finally she said the best she can do $20 per night .. What a rip off. Allah was the best front desk staff. Very courteous, very kind . Well I didn't have good experience there, I am not going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable for what it is”
Reviews.Author: bobinindy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our room at this hotel right now (6th floor). We've been here two nights and have two more to go...so this is kind of a 'real time' review. First, the front desk staff, especially Lucie and Julio, have been terrific. When we checked in, I asked about wi-fi and was told we were in the back section of the hotel and wi-fi was not available. I expressed my disappointment and immediately was switched to another room. When the wi-fi in our end-of-the-hall room didn't work, they gave us a 'booster.' After some fits and starts, it works fine (I'm using it now). The safe also hadn't been reprogrammed but that was taken care of rather quickly. The room itself is spacious and clean; though very, very dated. The big issue is the mattress. Sit on the bed, and you feel the spring work. We have two queen size beds. One mattress is so bad it sinks in the middle. The other is still lumpy, but it doesn't sink. Yeah, the furniture is quite old and the TV is the old square RCA with a converter box, but we aren't in Montreal to watch TV anyway so who cares? Parking at $15.00 a day?; I've paid more in Chicago. It's rather convenient to the two metro stations we've used most often and a nice stroll to St. Catherine and a couple of other major east-west streets. No smoking facility was big for us and this is. Look, this isn't a 4 or five star hotel. It is a nice three star and that's fine with us. It's serviceable and we haven't spent that much time in it anyway. Now we're headed to a pastry shop, recommended by Lucie, on Sherbrooke (I asked about one).

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, much better available”
Reviews.Author: CANDVD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends. We had 2 rooms. One room had a strange mold like odor and didnt really stay cool with the a/c. Pillows and beds were less comfortable than I'm used too. Rooms were quiet and housekeeping was very friendly. Location is a little west and south of the main downtown. We stayed here because a friend booked using priceline.

Reviews.Title: “rooms were stinky, old !! Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: DevilsCutePrincess
Reviews.Content: we got the deal from priceline for $ 100 ( tax + parking seperate) per night from upon arrival, the girl informed that they were overbooked (which didnt not looked like at all). We were given a room on 4th floor, the room was really old, musty smell and stinky. It reminded me of some horror movie. I called downstairs to change the room, but the same girl told me since i booked on priceline, we will be given whatever is left from the hotel. i wish i would have paid $20 extra and stayed at le sheraton down the road (about 5 mins away). i will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: dogmom127
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay directly on the hotel website and got a room with a kitchenette and jetted tub for a reasonable price. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were extremely helpful. The bed was quite comfortable for a hotel bed and we slept quite well. Free wireless internet worked great, and I was able to use the business center to print some documents. The only things keeping me from rating it a 5: The restaurant is extremely overpriced for food that is just OK. Fortunately, with the kitchenette we saved money by preparing and eating some of our own meals. Charge for parking at $15 a day. Not outrageous for a metro area, but still something to take into account. We went to the spa for a massage and while the service itself was very nice, there was no one there that spoke English! By contrast, the hotel reception always seemed to have at least one employee that spoke English. (Between the half dozen French words I know and the half dozen English words one young fellow knew, we managed to get by with our massage LOL!) Overall, a very positive experience. I probably won't get the opportunity to return to Montreal but if I do, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour&stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoppertheglobe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. Actually, it is not a hotel, rather a combination of condos and hotel rooms mixed in one building. Do not believe the photos on their website. We are told that those are lofts, not standard rooms. You enter the hotel after a long corridor. There are lots of tenants in the buildings. Some of them are bought by the hotel. You get into your smokey hotel room, open the curtains just to find out that windows have not been washed for ages. It is all muddy and dark. There is hair in the bathtub. When you flush the toilet, you hear a huge bang noise and the room shakes (seriously, have you had that at any other hotel?). The blanket has cigarette burns on them. The carpet has huge bleach stains. The tv is an old one, remember the tube tvs? No wireless. You have to connect with a 20 feet cable. In terms of the spa, we did not see it. There was nothing spa like at this hotel. If you are very desperate, yes, go for it. If you have a little respect for yourself, stay away from this hotel find a better deal at the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCM2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very big room and very pleasant and helpful staff, about 20 minutes walk to the main centre.

Reviews.Title: “Soiled bed spread - disgusting”
Reviews.Author: PC_SHE
Reviews.Content: Few remarks about their studio condos: Soiled and disgusting bed spread. I called for a replacement and they sent one that was even more disgusting. We left it on the floor. The sheets were burnt with cigarette butts. The spare sheets were burnt and torn. The iron board was disgusting and soiled. The iron had brown melted material stuck on its surface. After taking care of calling to validate my online reservation one week prior, I was surprised during check in by their lack of organisation when the clerk announced that my reservation was not taken care of. The clerk even argued that I they did not receive my reservation while I was showing their e-mail confirmation on my Blackberry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Nice rooms. Inconsistent service.”
Reviews.Author: JennXL
Reviews.Content: On a weekend trip to Montreal, a friend of mine and I each got a room at the Nouvel Hotel. We each booked a room through a third party site (Expedia, Priceline), which sometimes can lead to a negative experience, but not in this case. Both our rooms were on the 7th floor, which was the "Executive Floor". A few highlights: The rooms were large and well laid out. The pillows were extremely comfortable. My room was by the elevator but never noticed a lot of noise. The location was excellent. A block away from St. Catherine Street, it was near hundreds of shops and tons of restaurants. We never paid more than $10 for a cab ride to major attractions (Old Montreal, etc) To Be Aware Of: - The service at the front desk is inconsistent. While most of the service we received was pleasant, there were a few instances where some of the staff were not clear, or did not return calls when we asked for more information (regarding in-room services such as Wi-Fi and movie rentals). My suggestion is to always go to the front desk directly with questions as the service we got on the phone was always confusing or unclear, or non existent. - While some of their documentation indicates you have to pay for internet, it is, in fact, free. You need to get a code from the front desk. - If internet access is important, you may want to stay away from the ends of the hotel. The already weak signal seems even weaker at the ends of the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JW4444
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff, for the most part, was excellent and very helpful. The room attendants were also great and kept the rooms very clean. However, the hotel itself was horrible, as was the lack of follow up on customer complaints. When we got to our hotel room, it had a heavy smell of paint. We left the windows open for the day while we were out, hoping it would air out the odor. When we came back a few hours later, it still smelt of paint. We complained and were told they could not switch our room that night as the hotel was full (it did not look full). We told them that we did not feel comfortable sleeping in a room that had been freshly painted and smelt of paint, because we didn't want to breath in paint fumes. They suggested sleeping with the window open, which we did despite our room being absolutely freezing cold. We were told they'd try and switch our room the following morning. No one contacted us to switch our room. Absolutely no follow up - how shameful. The rooms are outdated. I wish I took a picture. Crappy furniture and an old, boxy television in the rooms. The windows are enormous and have no bars or screens when open. So be careful if you have small children or toddlers with you. The hallways smell of cigarettes, apparently they use to allow smoking in this hotel. The elevators are just gross and outdated. The bathrooms are also outdated, and the water pressure in the shower is low. There is no swimming pool. They appear to have upgraded the lobby only. This is a low-rise, crappy hotel that just isn't worth the price. I would never stay here again. If only the hotel had dealt with our complaint appropriately, this experience would not have left such a bitter taste in our mouths! Terrible, terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable. We were "upgraded" to a condo in the rear bldg, in actuality a studio with a small kitchen. We had gotten a great deal on the hotel website -- offseason rates. The room was clean, there was a flat screen TV, comfortable bed, all the usual bathroom amenities. Maybe not 4 star, but close. The hotel was walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops on Sherbrooke and to several Metro stations. Easy access to Mt Royal and the Old City by Metro. The front desk was friendly and helpful and internet was available on a desk top in the lobby. All in all, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Samaras74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our three day trip to Montreal and have to say the hotel was disappointing. The recent change to non-smoking is admirable but unfortunately the room/hallways/lifts all smelt of cigarette smoke. The decor was a little dated and the bed was uncomfortable. Some updating needs to be done. I'd also say that if you do stay - make sure you dont get a room next to the lifts, the clunking noises everytime they were in operation were a bit annoying. Also our room was not serviced for the duration of our stay. Good location for the Bell Centre and St Catherines St but little else to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel within walking distance to St. Catherine's Street and the Bell Center.”
Reviews.Author: YbAndGaL
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip last minute on priceline negotiator and after reading the reviews on here I was a bit nervous. I called the hotel to see what type of rooms that they had since priceline didn't give me any options. I spoke with Alex at the front desk and he described the rooms to me so it put me at ease. I checked in with my friend and we spoke with Alex at the front desk again. He was able to give us some VERY useful places as to where to go and eat. He was very friendly and helpful. The room we go had 2 queen beds. The bathroom was decent with the exception of the shower. I went to take a shower just after we arrived after traveling all day and I slipped in the shower. The grip on the tub had began to come off. Being March we had to put the heater on in the room and it kept my friend up most of the night because it was quite noisy. I however, was able to sleep through it for some reason. The hallways outside our room could use some updating. The hallways were painted brown and the carpet was outdated. It could be spruced up by simply a coat of white paint and a new carpet. You can park at the hotel for $15/day I would stay at this hotel again. My friend said that she would stay here again as long as it wasn't winter because of the noisy heater.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mmmikeyd
Reviews.Content: As someone who's stayed in hostels to 5-star hotels, I have to say, this hotel isn't as bad as some of the reviews would suggest. Understandably, everyone has different prerequisites for a hotel, so hopefully this review will help you decide if this hotel will meet your requirements. Affordability: We got a great deal on hotwire. ($75/night). The prices listed on the website were not much more than that. I would say hotels in downtown/midtown Montreal normally run you between $120-$150, so this was a great deal if you were on a budget, or saving your money for eating out and shopping! Location: It's about a 15 minute walk from the train station, and less than 5 minutes to the restaurants and shops on St.Catherine or the Bell Centre. Cab rides to the Old Montreal, the Casino, the restaurants on St.Laurent and the gay village were all under 15 bucks. There are two dÃ©paneurs (convenience stores) a minute away from the hotel where you can also pick up beer/wine. Rooms: The rooms are not what you might find at the Hilton or Sheraton. The furniture is antique-ish, and the decor is dated. Our room by the elevator was fairly large, but the other rooms we saw when the cleaning lady had the door open seemed pretty standard. Rooms were clean and did not have any strange odours (the carpet in the hallway needs a shampoo however...all that salt from the streets gets dragged into the hotel). The heater/A/C unit made a bit of a clicking sound now and than, but nothing loud or annoying. The TV is an old CRT and you get a decent list of channels (french and english). The king bed was firm but comfortable and did not sag in the middle. I did notice a water stain on the bed skirt, and the bedsheets had a couple of holes in them. But they were clean and the pillows were extremely comfortable! (Also, I did a check for bed bugs, as I do in every hotel, and didn't notice anything, so not to worrry) The bathroom was dated, and was equipped for people with disabilities (high toilet, and grips around the toilet and in the tub). It was bright and clean and never had a problem with hot water or pressure, however, the shower did make a bit of a 'drilling' sound when activated. There is a safe in the closet, and wifi is free when you get a code from the front desk. Service: Staff are fluent in English and French and were always kind, courteous and helpful. Amenities: There was room service available and prices were in the $20 range for a meal. We didn't eat at the hotel, but it's nice that the option was there. Pool is outdoors, and from what I saw, pretty small. The gym is in the basement and also pretty small with some cardio equipment, freeweights and a standard weight machine but it does the trick! The spa is also in the basement. The staff are friendly, but not all are bilingual, which can make conversation a bit awkward. There is a change room, 1 'whirl pool', 1 'jacuzzi' and 2 saunas. It's $20 to use them, but they provide you with a lock and key for the lockers in the changeroom. If you book a spa appointment, the $20 fee is waived. The standard massage was pretty soft. If you're looking for something a little more deep-tissue, definitely ask for it. They have a full range of treatments from relaxation, hot stone, deep tissue and foot, along with all other spa treatments (wax, pedi-/mani, etc). So all in all, was it bad? No. Was it high-style? No. Was it convenient, comfortable and pleasant? Yes, yes and yes.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended at all”
Reviews.Author: carboren
Reviews.Content: The bed was hard as a rock. The room was outdated, the electric switch in the bathroom was not working properly (unsafe), the hallway stinks. Seriously, you should spend an extra $10 to go somewhere nicer. The only nice thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: awp2005
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and big room but furnitures are somewhat old?? maybe it was suppose to be an old world charm style?? anyhow location is perfect, short walking distance to everything! Perfect base to explore the city. Skip their restaurant, food is mediocre at it best.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Chango57
Reviews.Content: I arrived in this Hotel the day of a great storm and felt inmediatly relaxed. Check-in was fluent and with a smile. The room was warm (not hot) and nicely decorated. Good restaurant with plenty of choice. In better weather circumstances you can walk to restaurants and bars. Personal always ready to offer their help, friendly and good educated. Good price quality relation. Certainly a place where I will return when visiting Montreal again, but I hope I will be more lucky with the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel over New Years”
Reviews.Author: qchord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Years. On New Year's Eve and the night of New Year's Day, there were a group of youth from Toronto also staying at this hotel on various floors. Both nights, they ran up and down the hotel, banging doors and screaming- all night. Hotel security and police were called, but nothing was done. We didn't sleep for two nights. In addition, a pipe burst and the carpet in our room got all wet. We were eventually moved to a different room, which was slightly better. In the new room, the couch was ripped and the sofa bed was uncomfortable. There was a strong smoky smell from the neighboring condos. For a four star hotel, it was one of the worst hotel stays we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Five Star Hotel for the price of Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BertandCathie
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front were wonderful, beautiful hotel. There is a lot more to Montreal than we had time to see. beautiful scenery, great restuarants places like Baton Rouge great food.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: karateMontreal
Reviews.Content: For a karate tournament we needed over 20 rooms at this hotel. Then we had to make some changes, we also needed a small reception room for the weigh-in . EVERY TIME, the person in charge of the group reservation at this hotel, miss Natasha Sherma, was always patient, very eager to please our needs. It has been a very nice ans easy experience to deal with her. Again , thank you. Sylvie C.-L.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GlobeSurfer5
Reviews.Content: Entering the front lobby, you get the impression of a very nice and modern hotel. The lobby is super clean and decorated very tastefully. This would be a great hotel if I happened to sleep in the lobby, but as it turns out, I like sleeping on beds. So, I go to my room and am very disappointed when I see it. The room reminds me of an old Best Western with dirty late 1980s carpet and those absurd and tacky bed covers/blankets that never get washed. They even have one of those brown "foamy" blankets under the bed cover. Hello, its 2010. Where is the nice clean WASHABLE Duvet Cover and Comforter? Just by looking at the Mattress from the Door I can tell that the bed sags in the middle and is lower on the side of the TV. It's a "lop sided bed" - for lack of a better way of describing it. All these hotels have to do is just come through and ROTATE the mattresses on a yearly basis, but you can tell this one hasn't been rotated at all since it was put down over 10 years ago. Aside from the Bed, the Furnishings show good signs of wear and the TV is older than I can imagine. To give the room some credit, the bathroom is clean and the carpet, despite being old, was vacuumed. In short, If you like getting a good nights rest, and old 1980's style sheets, foam blankets, and "lop sided" beds aren't your thing. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great city!”
Reviews.Author: jb19740001
Reviews.Content: First time in Montreal for more than a day & didn't know what to expect. The staff @ Nouvel Hotel helped track down area attractions & were tip-top in terms of service. Location also quite good - walking distance from two bus stops & also two metro stops. Room was quite comfortable & with enough room to spread out all my stuff. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cristian C
Reviews.Content: Despite being close to downtown the room was on average condition, very dirty windows, TV in a very poor condition, the swimming pool is located outside-during a rainy day it's impossible to be used- they suggested to use an indoor pool located nearby, very dirty and in a very poor shape cover lamps. For a three stars ranking I was expecting something better.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay - we don't understand the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: LondonDavidUK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay of five nights at the Nouvel - it was better than we expected. We were somewhat apprehensive before our visit because of a few very negative reviews - however our room was clean, bright and well equipped - there was a useful room safe - all the staff we spoke to were helpful and polite - the breakfast buffet was of excellent quality and reasonably good value - the location was good - just three or four minutes walk to St Catherine's Street which has plenty of shops and restaurants and there are two useful convenience shops close to the hotel. If you are coming from the airport you can use the airport express bus 747 which stops at Rue Guy just a block from the hotel. Whilst there we did the Grayline trip to Quebec which we have no hesitation in recommending - the feeder bus which took us from the hotel to the main departure point was a few minutes late and the hotel desk staff were helpful in phoning Grayline for us to check that we had not been forgotten. We had no problem with he broadband access and we were able to use the computers in the lobby when we needed to print a couple of pages. The only negative point is the pool - it is very small - it does not open until 10am (I guess because it is close to the condos which are part of the complex) and the corridor to the pool is in urgent need of decoration. We enjoyed our stay - don't be put off by the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost.”
Reviews.Author: Walterk55
Reviews.Content: Outright liars! The worst experience we have had in Montreal. We reserved through hotelhotline.com. We were to have a non-smoking room, and kingsize bed, and breakfast included. When we arrived at the hotel registration we were told that the hotel only considered our choices thru hotelhotline.com as "preferences" and that we were getting NO BREAKFAST, and a SMOKING ROOM and two queen size beds. And there was nothing we could do about it since we had already paid. They refused our request to move to a non-smoking room after the first night. Talk about a friendly reception !! AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS, AND HOTELHOTLINE.COM AS WELLâ€Ž

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: hjr006
Reviews.Content: We paid about $160 for one night in this hotel in Montreal. We arrived at 2:30 and were permitted to check in to our room (check in isnt until 3PM). However, the beds had no pillowcases, the room hadnt been vacuumed and there were no towels. I called to the front desk and we had pillowcases within about 30 minutes but the towels took another 40ish minutes (as they were being washed?!). When the towels arrived we only received three bath towels and no face/hand towels. The room itself was very spacious, but the bedding was old and dated. The room and bathroom looked a little rough and dated. Our room faced the front where there is a busy road so it was quite loud in the evening and morning iwth trucks etc. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel itself was clean and in a great location. We found the location to be quiet compared with other areas of Montreal where we've stayed before. Its a quick 5 minute walk to the bell centre, 5-10 minutes to the heart of St. catherine's street and lots of restaurants and nightlife. The best thing about this hotel was definitely the location!

Reviews.Title: “We were quite happy with out stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Thomas46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We had a very spacious room with a king-sized bed and a kitchenette. Room and bathroom were spotless. Hotel staff was very busy and seemed frazzled when we were checking in, and omitted to tell me that I would need a cable to access the free WIFI. Our stay included free breakfast, and while the breakfast buffet was very good, the servers at the restaurant were surly and rude. One waitress pretty much looked right through me when I motioned to my coffee cup. But otherwise, we were quite happy staying at this hotel which is just a few blocks away from the downtown nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Louislesvins
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at le Nouvel Hotel for NASCAR weekend in Montreal. LOCATION The location is best. Right beside the highway, minutes away *(walk) from main attractions, easy access, just a little bit away from the bars/clubs so you don't hear the noise. ROOMS The rooms were average. Unconfortable beds, small pillows, not too clean. TV sets from pre-historic age, NOISY A/C and very small washrooms. STAFF We had reserved a non-smoking , 2 x queen beds room. We got a smoking king! After showing our reservation paper, they quickly gave us a 2 queen room but it was smoking. Since it was a full house, NASCAR weekend, people were running around in the hallway at 2:00AM screaming and slamming doors. But it stopped after 30 min (maybe they got complaints) So it was an overall OK experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, personnel very helpful, room very nice”
Reviews.Author: mjlnana
Reviews.Content: Very good location, personnel very knowledgable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night and were really impressed. Our room was enormous and spotless w/a kitchenette, washer & dryer, and sitting area. I think the price was $119 w/AAA and it included parking and breakfast. I called 7 or 8 hotels in the area and all were much more expensive. We'll stay again -- great find.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Rude Staff, Overcharging, and BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: hugoinlove
Reviews.Content: To sum it all, one of the worst experiences of a hotel in north america. If I can rate 0, i would! very rude staff, room is filthy! at check-in, reception told me there are everything available in the room, but after we went into our room, we realised there was nothing there! not even towels!! apparently they have forgotten about putting towels in the bathroom, I dared to use them, as they were yellowish and smell! worst of the worst! I realised I got invaded by bed bugs the next morning! how "great" this is!!

Reviews.Title: “Small complaints but good enough value overall”
Reviews.Author: jackmiov69
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and nice and bright. I think they bought some condo units and turned them into hotel rooms. It was the only hotel room I have ever been in with a hardwood floor. Best kitchenette I have ever seen in a non-suite room. Full set of dishes, cutlery, and glassware, a 2-element smoothtop stove, a 5-piece stainless steel cookware set, a BIG microwave, and a fully empty fridge (no expensive $$nacks taking up room), coffee machine, sink, dish soap... BIG very comfy kingsize bed... it is very quiet at night and both me and my wife slept better than at home. Caveats - The hotel advertised free WiFi, and gave me the login code, but my laptop could not detect the network, even when I manually entered the SSID. Fortunately somebody living nearby had an unsecured network that I promptly mooched. There are no curtains. It has sheer curtains but I imagine the neighbours can see right through them. And if you want to make the room dark so you can sleep during the day, forget it.. I was upset that I had to check out in person. Many hotels now have speedy checkout where all you have to do is call the front desk and tell them you are leaving. At this place I had to wait in line for fifteen minutes to check out, and nearly missed my train leaving the city. I suppose it is my fault for not planning for that. Fair warning: allow an extra 20 minutes to checkout! The outdoor pool is very small... maybe 10x20 feet maximum. Good enough for cooling off, as long as nobody else is there... Breakfast is your standard hotel buffet. Expensive ($16 per person after tax and gratuity which they have 'helpfully' included in your bill) Despite these negatives it is still a fine hotel and at $110 a night (if you prepay, nonrefundable) a good deal for being in downtown montreal. St Catherine street shopping is only a few minutes walk away and the train station is walkable too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay... no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: jam1139
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying here for two nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room delightful and had all the amenities we required. No problems with Wifi on 7th floor. We only spoke English and staff were all bilingual which was a huge help to us. I would stay there again in a heartbeat if ever we are in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pahotel01
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel highly.Very central location and got a great rate. Room was big and clean.there was also a mini bar.No milk for tea though!! Very happy, grat staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION GOOD SERVICE GOOD PRICE”
Reviews.Author: canadianbillOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nites last week while on vacation first time to montreal the hotel was easily found off highway blocks from catherine and sherbrooke streets. We arrived early before check in but were allowed to park car and check in later the desk people were great help from the start with maps and things to see and do. The rooms were quite sufficient for what we needed big in size and comfortable and the ac worked very well so well we had to turn it down. The only negitives i can say were that the first morn for breakfast was suppose to be served at 6:30 but didnt get bacon or eggs etc on buffet till 7ish which was no big deal. The food wasnt great the scrambled eggs were a lil runny but cereales etc were fine .There was enough food to satisfy you. The pool was deceiving from what i seen on website it was small i wouldnt want more then 10 ppl in a t once but no one was in when we were so it worked out fine it was big enough to cool of and small enough u couldnt drowned. Also while there we did the pedicure at the spa the cost was 35 bucks at she did a very good job. All in all it was a great stay and if ever in montreal again we will chose the le nouvel hotel. And a BIG thanks to adam( i think his name was) for all his extra pointers on subway places to eat etc very pleasant young guy who was genuinley only to glad to help.

Reviews.Title: “Run fast from this place”
Reviews.Author: babbyNyc
Reviews.Content: Sounds decent on the internet until you get there. Your pushing it if you call this a 3 star. Our AC buzzed constantly, and the blanket on my bed had a chunk missing out of it. The location is not good bc you have to walk up a long street that has a park where drunks hang out. The pool is big enough to hold 6-7 people. No bellman. We stayed one night and transferred to Loews Vogue Hotel which was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: blacknighthawk
Reviews.Content: Le Nouvel Hotel Montreal is such a nice and charming hotel. Rooms are well kept and the staff are all accommodating. Its value for money at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - decent value”
Reviews.Author: MattVernon
Reviews.Content: A decent value for price and location. Montreal hotels are more expensive than most cities, but the Le Nouvel is an acceptable value - it isn't located in any desirable part of town, but the bus stops across the street, the Metro is a five minute walk, and St. Catherine and Crescent streets (the best areas of Montreal not listed in the travel books) are only a block away. After exploring all the neighborhoods, we found St. Catherine St. to be our favorite, so the location of the hotel worked out well. The hotel lobby is very nice and the hotel staff was very professional and friendly. The biggest negative was the free wireless Internet - which works fine in the lobby, but on the fourth floor, was worse than dial-up. The staff tried nobly to help by giving me a wireless access point to use, but it didn't help wifi speeds - this is something that definitely needs to be addressed by the hotel, and can be easily (and cheaply) fixed by installing wireless access points on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “I was so relieved to be there”
Reviews.Author: TravelAuntieAlberta
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Montreal feeling a little off-color following the train trip from Toronto. By the time my taxi arrived at the hotel, I must have been looking rather green about the gills, because a man coming down the hotel steps immediately took charge of me and my luggage, presented me to the desk clerk and asked that someone help me to my room. That evening and all the next day, I suffered from some sort of 24-hour flu. I existed on room service and only ventured out once, to find a pharmacy. I'm sure someone would have gone there for me, because the staff was so helpful, but I enjoyed my leisurely walk around the block, and found it to be an interesting, comfortable neighborhood. When I went to the hotel's restaurant in person, I found the staff there to be just as friendly and helpful. I had been brushing up on my French, but as soon as I said, "Je ne parle pas beaucoup de Francais" everyone said, "That's okay, I speak English."

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustFio
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean, and the service was great. The room was larger than expected and my bf and I snuggled on the couch watching tv :) The room was equipped with a microwave and fridge which was extremely convenient for our stay in Montreal. The hotel is located near a McDonalds, Dominoes pizza, sushi etc and the metro is only 2 blocks away. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the $100 dollars extra they charge for "incidentals." However, if no damage is done to the room etc, then the money is refunded. Overall I enjoyed my stayed. I was extremely appreciative that the staff is bilingual (English and French), since my french is very bad.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service, room and food”
Reviews.Author: sultan-pirouette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were organising an "family association reunion" of nearly 90 persons (from US and Canada) for 3 days (May 21 to 23 2010. The personel (front desk, restaurant and group coordinator Madame Jean) was fantastik and helpfull. Rooms were very large and clean and sound proof. During 3 days, our requests were always met by either Madame Jean and Mr. Umberto. The food was outstanding (in the restaurant (one dinner and breakfasts - although breakfasts were a bit expensive) or in the meeting rooms reserved for our group (2 lunches and one sitdown dinner). Very good quality for the price. Nice quiet little terrace surrounded by buildings, you do not feel being in the heart of a big city. Few blocks from Bell Center and 1 block to Ste-Catherine street. we parked our car in the inside garage and took it again 3 days later. Even if we live on the Montreal island, we had not discover this "gem". As it is just off the hyway, people who do not like to drive in the city, just parked and walked. I would recommend this hotel anytime. Susanne M.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Maigemu
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable especially for the price (Â£78pn Expedia). The hotel is on one of the main roads into the centre of Montreal but is quiet and in a safe neighbourhood. There are two metro lines nearby plus buses running outside if you don't fancy the 15 minute walk into the city centre. There are good restaurants within walking distance on Ste Catherines near the Metro Station Guy-Concorde. The receptionists and other staff are very friendly and helpful. Downside was the lack of tea bags in the bedroom (not a major problem) and the pricing of breakfast. We had full breakfast on two days without realising that a coffee and toast option, at a lower cost, was available. At $16pp, full breakfast is usual hotel price but we didn't really need a full meal. However, I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: AlteOma
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed a 4-day stay in this hotel. The location is excellent - 15-minute walk from the train station, and within walking distance of most of the attractions we wished to see in Montreal. The room was roomy, clean and pleasant and the beds were excellent. An extra pillow was provided in the room, along with an ironing board and iron. Restaurant associated with the hotel was not fancy, but good - we had several meals there. Desk service and housekeeping were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nbano
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quiet, clean, and on a prime location. It was closed to Concordia University and a variety of restaurants including those serve Halal meet. Metro station, Train station were quite closed to this hotel as wee.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND VERY FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: minnie609104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with friends for 4 nights - the staff were very helpful and friendly. We had excellent meals at the restaurant. The rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. Needless to say I would recommend this Hotel to anyone wishing to visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: maid11
Reviews.Content: Laundry facilities in building close enough to walk to most venues friendly staff restaurant has great breakfast for reasonable price great rooms just like the pictures on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Room was clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Richtree7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just 1 night (last night). Got the room on Priceline.com for $73 plus taxes, etc.-- Parking $15 in the underground garage. Didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, no free breakfast due to booking via Priceline. Internet was free but w-ifi reception in the room was very limited to poor. My recommendation to friends would be yes, hotel is fine....unless in room wi-fi is important. Also, my cell phone, which is on the pre-paid Sprint network, did not function in Montreal this trip. I've been to Montreal 5 times (all short stays) in the past 4 months. My cell had always operated fine in the previous 4 trips though it was always roaming while in Montreal. This time not so. Each time I attempted to make a call the robot operator voice informed me no service unless using a credit card or reversing charges.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to sleep at night.”
Reviews.Author: jweathers
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a cheap place to lay your head at night, this place isn't bad. Unfortunately, they bill themselves as a hotel and spa, and the spa is weak at best. I believe they converted a corner of the parking garage for the spa. The fitness center was worthless and maybe dangerous since there is no staff around in the tiny basement room it is housed in. The swimming pool is outside and unheated, making it useless when we were there in April. The breakfast buffet was nothing to write home about either. I would definitely plan on going out for all your meals if you are in Montreal as a tourist. We were also there during Spring Break for a bunch of High School kids from Boston who were enjoying the low drinking age and legalized marijuana so be careful when you go. Otherwise, the room was spacious although a little odd-smelling (we were in the condo section). The hotel is close to a lot of shopping and Chinatown if that interests you. 'The staff was courteous, especially the bartender, Xavier. The city parking attendant was exceptionally rude, however. The free wi-fi signal was weak most of the time and non-existent at other times. Next time I will be skipping the spa and staying in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Shikarajah
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where to start. This was my second trip to MontrÃ©al and a friend of mine booked the hotel online with 2 queenâ€™s size bed. We arrived at our hotel and the next thing we find out is that what we reserved was not what we got. We got a room with one dirty bed. The place smelled like smoke and dirt. There was only one staff working in the entire hotel. The receptionist could not even communicate with us properly. OMG i been to so many hotel, but this place was worse then a motel. I would not never ever stay there again nor would I recommend this place to anyone. Overall the hotel ws not clean; we did not get what we booked, the staff was very rude and overall customer service was lacking. Please refrain from staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Cate777
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review before and going through the review have seen that mine and other negative reviews have been deleted for some reason and a large number of positive reviews added. Also, I didn't see the comments on the reviews by the owners before. Makes me wonder how accurate these reviews are anyway... This place stinks, the rooms are filthy, they were fumigating for bed bugs when we were there and it seems that that is a reoccurring problem. The service was bad!!! They only had 1 luggage trolley in the whole place. We were let into a room where - there was either someone staying there or it hadn't been cleaned yet. That was after we were given a room that was so stinky that I almost had an asthma attack. I'm sure the health board should be called into this place. Anyone writing a positive review of this place is either staff or owner. I have never experience such a dump and I back packed through Europe and the Middle East when I was younger.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Great value”
Reviews.Author: Morjohn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very appealing from the outside and only 1 block from St. Catherines Street. The reception area is all right as well. Our room was a corner room on the 7th floor and was a nice size with a couch, coffee table, desk, dresser, fridge, microwave and coffee pot. It appeared to be newly renovated with carpet, curtains, bedspread etc. (although the sheets were worn). The bathroom had Aveda amenities and complimentary newspapers in the front lobby. We did not eat in the restaurant but they have a wonderful happy-hour in the bar adjoining and the atmosphere was pleasant and quiet. This is a great place to stay for the price and the location but not if you are looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “The queens and kings of customer service!”
Reviews.Author: mcgukat
Reviews.Content: Originally book this hotel for it's excellent location and great price, but wound up being dazzled by the service of the front desk staff. We had to increase the length of our stay twice due to a family emergency and the staff bent over backwards to help us! I can't say enough about the people at the front desk especially Lucie and Genenvive!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AprilSydney
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large but that's the only plus point. They also: > Give off a feeling of being unclean > Have very uncomfortable (hard) beds > Have bad TV reception > Don't have complimentary tea. Only coffee. > House keeping that takes a very long time to get to your room > Really lame excuse for a hair drier > windows with curtains that don't close > NO room service on Saturdays!! The hotel staff are nice enough but the lobby area looks really old and again - not the cleanest. There were two computers with free internet and a printer in the little business centre but one was out of order for most of our 3 night stay. The computers themselves are not updated with the latest software (no flash sites). The hotel restaurant is poor - average though the staff are nice. We went down for lunch at 2pm on Saturday (what with there being no room service and all) and got told back to come back at 2:30 (even though the entire restaurant was empty) because some of the tables were still dirty from the customers who had just left. This is more like a motel than a starred hotel. Really disappointing. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in MTL.”
Reviews.Author: mtl2mia
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional and frequent visitor to Montreal, I was very impressed with this property. The service was outstanding. They were helpful in finding a specific store that I was looking for, directing us to the closest Metro and were always courteous and professional. The room was very nice and included robes (a must for me). It was comfortable and quiet with ample space. It was very clean (also a must). We visited the spa located on the lower level. It was nice; we both enjoyed hour long massages. The location was excellent, just a few minute walk away from excellent shopping and dining and within a very short walk to multiple Metro stations. Parking was a bit confusing, as the property does not have an area to pull off of the street and check in and find parking. It is located behind the hotel. As an additional parking warning, the garage is VERY small in dimensions.
