I drove a small sedan which fit into a spot with little room on the sides, but I don't believe that the Ford Explorer that we were going to take would fit into the garage. What I liked best was the location with shopping dining and Metro nearby. What I liked least was the parking, but it did work for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BlaineJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay Montreal . It was well within walking distance to great shopping, dining ,and sports.

Reviews.Title: “Le Nouvel Hotel - Montreal, Quebec, Canada”
Reviews.Author: RLF1967NYC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Even though our room faced the busy street on the front of the hotel, we never heard noises. The room was very well kept. Nice furnishings, though they could've had an ottoman for the chair. Free wireless internet service accessible from the room. Bathroom was sparse, but functional. Great cable tv -- many channels to choose from, if you liked (though Montreal being such a great city, why you would spend much time in front of the tv is a mystery to me). The hotel includes a full 'American breakfast' in its price. Very good food, even if it was the same thing day in and out. At least you could fuel up for the day's adventure ahead and not need to worry about where to get breakfast. Excellent service at the front desk. If you need a refrig in your room, ask and it shall be delivered promptly. Same thing goes for bathrobes! It is a centrally located hotel, and well worth the modest room rates. Excellent value! We would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: SeattleReebs
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a comfortable bed and a lot of space. The room was clean. And the location was good, in the center of the city and a short walk to the subway. However, we were on a non-smoking floor with smokers right below us. When our downstairs neighbors smoked, it was vented into our bathroom. The front desk offered to spray some scented spray as a solution, we preferred smoke to chemicals. The safe didn't work and the front desk offered no viable solution until we insisted they keep our valuables for us. Overall a comfortable hotel, but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a visit to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: cioco
Reviews.Content: Good location for a visit to Montreal. Rooms were large and comfortable. Staff was polite and effcient. Very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MalleleHouston
Reviews.Content: Booked a hotel for 8 days late Aug/early Sept. through Hotwire. Once I was told the Hotel was Le Nouvel I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and was very concerned by the negative comments. The lobby was quite nice, but when the elevator doors opened and saw the somewhat dingy corridor I was really worried. However, the room was large, very clean, the bathroom had new fixtures, clean, everything worked. True, the furniture was somewhat dated, but the bed was comfortable, I found no fault with the linens, did see a small tear in the blanket, but it was clean. Having a kitchenette saved me oodles of money, since breakfast was not included. I fixed my own breakfast and even supper, heating stuff in the microwave and small stove top. I found a nice store on Rue St. Catherine and purchased food stuffs there. The best of all, however, was the bilingual front desk staff who patiently and courteously helped me find my way around. I lived in Montreal in the 50's and wanted to retrace the past, where we immigrants lived, where I worked, shopped, most of it off the tourist path and without their help I could not have done it. Merci beaucoup! The only complaint I have was the slower than snails internet, which they will be upgrading shortly. Mallele PS - Used the Metro extensively, it is easy to understand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: keloaa
Reviews.Content: Great deal, great location, just one street to downtown & shopping center, rooms was so clean & big. Breakfast was buffet all the time, everything was fresh. Front desk people was so poilte & could speak 3 languages.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Brontecat
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I stayed at the same hotel according to some of the previous reviews. We stayed in a condo suite for four nights and were very satisfied. The room was huge, nicely decorated, immaculately clean and very quiet. The bed was very comfortable and the bed linens were in perfect condition. The kitchenette was very convenient and nicely appointed. We parked on the street for free and because we were so close to the subway, rarely used the car. The neighbourhood is safe and quiet. The staff are very helpful and accommodating. We had a great rate for Montreal and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, needless to say more!”
Reviews.Author: JaaMa
Reviews.Content: At first the hotel seemed nice and clean. Basic beds with a basic bathroom with even Neutrogena stuff in there. TV's remote control didn't work. Location was okey especially if you're keen on shopping. My friend bought a new dress and when she got her first bites we figured it most have come from the dress. It appeared to us just a couple of days later that there were actually bed bugs. My friend looks horrible not to mention all the laudring we've been doing. Moreover, we might have brought bed bugs to my friend's sister's place. We just found one from their futon and they spread fast!!! I suggest you check out your beds really carefully and don't leave any of yor stuff on the floor. If possible, don't go. I'll never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrairieCook
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire expecting a 3.5* hotel. Once we found out we were staying at Le Nouvel Hotel, I called the hotel directly and I requested a no smoking room. The receptionist said that wasn't a problem and said it was entered in our reservation. When we arrived at the hotel in the evening, we were told that there was only a smoking room available. I explained that I called the hotel directly but was told nothing was on file and "you did book with Hotwire." The front staff told me they had overbooked so there was nothing available. Finally after asking again if they could find me a no smoking room, they gave us a non-smoking room on the condo side. When we opened the door, the room had a very strong odour similar to moth balls, very nauseating. I immediately called the front desk and informed them. They told me that there was nothing they could do because they were overbooked. All they could do was send a service man up to see if he could do anything. The service person came (this is at around 11pm) and said it wasn't right the room smelled this bad. He was very helpful (wasn't able to resolve the problem though) and offered to open up one of the windows. This involved many trips. Finally, about 1/2 hr later he managed to do so, but with difficulty. He told us to call the front desk in the morning to get a new room. Since we backed onto a busy street, it was pretty loud sleeping that night. The odour was still strong with the windows open. Needless to say we never did get a new room.... When we checked out I explained to the front desk that I was disappointed that they couldn't find me a different room despite my phone calls. The front desk was polite but only responded "I am sorry that you didn't enjoy your stay. I can have the manager call you." There was no offer to credit us, I was expected to pay the full amount to stay in a horrible room. Needless to say, no one has called me back. I can accept the room is dated, but all I wanted was a non-smoking room that had no strong odours. Other things... The lobby looks nice and after that the hotel is very dated. The gym is nothing to be excited about. It is in a small basement room.

Reviews.Title: “We had fun, breakfast was nice, but it is not as luxurious as appears to be online.”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Hello! We had a great time here. The front desk was wonderful and helpful. The room was a little bit old fashioned and not very luxurious as it seems in photos online. The elevator is slow, maids a little grouchy, business center (2 computers by the lobby) were dying turtle slow, and water pressure in the shower was slight. Swimming pool was a good little walk through many halls, and it was tiny. Swimming laps was silly. The gym left a lot to be desired and there were better locations. However, we still had fun and no big problems. The breakfast which was included in our AAA rate was wonderful! THey also had a lovely courtyard. WE just had come from a much more contemporary and comfortable hotel in Toronto and paid less.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out early...not up to moderate standards”
Reviews.Author: NativeNYer019
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. Looked much better on line than in real life. Was supposed to stay 3 nights but left after one. Granted it is not the absolute worst place, but if you are the type of person who likes a clean, comfortable room with fresh sheets and towels, this hotel will disappoint you too. Bed was terribly uncomfortable, but even worse the sheets were so worn and old that they didn't even look clean or washed. Same with the towels. Everything about the room felt old and dingy and borderline unclean. For me that's not a comfortable way to spend any amount of time. We checked out so that we could enjoy the rest of our stay in Montreal and not have to dread coming back to the room after a long day enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - glad it was not too much”
Reviews.Author: TennisGuy27
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Hotwire - and I am glad, when I was at the front desk I found out the regular rates - I would not pay those for this place. Rooms - spacious - but dated. Service - no issues. Activities - the pool was very small. Misc - centrally located - could walk to everywhere in Montreal. 3/5

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tamiwami
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was in a great location. It was clean, good service and would be a place i would stay at again. It was a good price and overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Dump”
Reviews.Author: squ1ggy
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Hotwire as a 4 star hotel. Our room smelled of smoke, the hallways where musty and the pool was non-existant. Staff was great though so not all bad, but very far from a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not A 4, Not Even A 3 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Snufflenox
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated near the Bell Center (MontrÃ©al Canadiens hockey club) and about 10 - 15 minute walk to anywhere downtown and a 5 minute walk to a subway station (Lucien Lallier or Guy Concordia). Rooms are clean but EVERYTHING is badly outdated. The hotel's own website rate Â«itselfÂ» as a 4 stars, some sites 3.5, others 3... This is a 2 star MAX! It's clean and all, but don't expect anything better than a ComfortInn or Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Fair rooms but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: indianprincess_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a weekend trip to Montreal and decided to stay here. We were pleasently surprised, we got there at 12 and our booking wasn't until 3 but they still gave us our room. We got to our room and it was outdated, but overall it was clean. The bed was confortable but what was gross was there was a huge burn stain in the blanket. We opened the drawers and found 2 extra pillows and an extra blanket which was a plus. We got all the tv channels and we got a wifi key and got to surf the net on our cell phones, so we can plan the day before we leave the hotel. Oh and I love how close it is to St. Catherine. What I didn't like is it was supposed to be a 4 star so we paid the 4 star price but it was so outdated. We felt we didn't get our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Le Nouvel Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: nivika
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located as it is near to vieux Montreal, Visitor Center and Shopping Malls. We had a nice room on the second floor for an attractive price (booked via visitor center) Although the room was to the street, we felt it was clean and very spacious and luxurious compared to others. The hotel itself looked old, but well maintained and skillfully decorated. Breakfast was very good. We recommend this hotel for a single night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Barely 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: KeepinItSimple
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet area towards the outskirts of Montreal, which is the only plus about this place. I was informed that this was a 4 star hotel, and it barely is a 2 star hotel. Fake flower bouquets in the room; small old style TV; dingy hallway; cigarette holes in the sheer window curtains, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: FIOREGJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in September. The hotel is definitely worth the ~115 per night, including breakfast. The key is to understand whether it meets your individual expectations. If you enjoy staying in the room and having a nice time in the hotel, this probably won't work. If you are looking for a decent, clean place to stay that is close to the action, this hotel works perfectly. It is one block from St. Catherine, toward the rougher end (absolutely safe but definitely gets nicer toward the other end). Room is reasonably sized, bathroom is bright and clean but not as nice as most other big name hotels, also the shower/tub is not huge (as I mentioned, won't lure you into staying in the room). Bed is reasonably comfortable, room can be completely darkened with the blackout curtains, and the AC works well but is a bit loud. TV is old school but works fine. Little kitchen area is quite nice with burner, sink, microwave, and coffee pot. Taxi is $38 from the airport. Hotel has a nice breakfast and a spa that offers a bunch of services. Internet is free and there are two computers in the lobby. Small gym with a couple of cardio machines and some free weights. I didn't check out the pool but saw signs pointing toward it. Staff is extremely polite and helpful, the first room I went into had some strong scent so they moved me quickly. Also had an issue with the in-room safe (wouldn't open with my room key) and maintenance came up and opened for me in ~5-10 minutes. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: jngo25
Reviews.Content: BAD EXPERIENCE, NEVER AGAIN!! Apparently when next door takes a dump, the odour slowly creeps into your room. The washroom floor was sticky, which was quite alarming, and the "NON-SMOKING" room smelled like smoke and had an ash tray!! The furniture is OUTDATED, the actual le nouvel website had some decent looking pictures, but when you get there, its quite deceiving! The only nice thing about the hotel is the nice lobby. The staff there ignored me when I walked in the door, and after 10 minutes, they finally realized they had a customer waiting. Save your money, your better off at a motel!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Not Great Just Average”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. It's neat and clean and up to date, but the rooms smell like cigarette smoke. The front desk service is what you would expect, nothing special. The location is OK. It's quite the walk to old Montreal, but you could catch the metro. It's only about 1km to get to the city center and area bars. I think the hotel is a bit pricey for what it is. Overall I feel pretty neutral on the hotel. I would look at other hotels to stay at next time, but if I didn't find anything better in the price range I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised at LeNouvell”
Reviews.Author: Sceneitall
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, it appears Nouvell Hotel has made some improvements. The desk staff attendants were pleasant and informative, the room was clean and quiet, the lobby was attractive. Close walk to downtown or to the subway connection to Old Montreal. Booked last minute through the Quebec tourist information site on St Catherine, at a great rate. Very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: “should be called the old shack”
Reviews.Author: tostie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very unpleasant the moment we walked in we noticed that the place was not updated due to the orange lounge chairs..The front reception desk was nice but the staff were bitter and had no idea where anything was in Montreal. They donâ€™t offer early check in we had arrived at 8 am and had to wait until 3pm to get our room. The room: Basically i slept in better Motels then this joint. The room was not updated, not enough light in the room the bed was hard and the bed sheets smelled bed covers were thin we called room service for extra blankets never came, its a two flush toilet we stayed on the 7 flr in the old part of the hotel we face the street over looking the St Margaret De Youlive The bathroom As mention before it was a two flush toilet the floor are blue and the counter were in tiles and is held by a picket. The water either to hot or to cold I wouldnâ€™t recommend the room if you are staying for more then one night l donâ€™t about the rest of the hotel but this my experience from it Area Its about 9 blocks from the downtown core its does have two corner stores in the area its close to the highway two blocks from the main street the Metro is a fast system just stay on the green and orange lines each ticket is about 2.75 35 dollars from the airport

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: celeste1
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, in my life. I am a experienced traveller and this place was gross. The chairs in the lobby are ripped, we booked a studio suite and went to a scary location where they have apartments mixed with hotel rooms. We asked for nonsmoking, we could smell smoke.The linens were dirty, no shampoo or condtioner in room. There was mold in the shower on the walls, the placed smelled. I was only there for 1 night and you could not pay me to go back there. The place should be shut down. All I can say is DISASTER.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: ABCWXYZ
Reviews.Content: Listed as a 4 star and is definately not. Front staff were rude and not helpful in the least. Housekeeping was inept and neglectful. Also is two blocks away from fire station and would have been nice to know that prior to booking. Way too overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and we'll return.”
Reviews.Author: DW614
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Le Nouvel over the Canada Day weekend, and we were pleasantly surprised with the cleaniness and quality of the room, as we were apprehensive after reading some unfavourable reviews about the hotel. The hotel was easy to find, being right on Rene Levesque. There is an underground parking available for $15/night (has in/out privilege), and just a note to those driving a SUV or truck - the height max is about 6FT., and the ceilings are exposed with pipes/wires in some areas of the parking lot, so be sure to remove any overhead baggages before entering the lot, or they'll fall off your car (or worse, damage the roof). We drove a SUV, and we were just a couple of inches lower than the ceiling, and have never seen a ceiling that hangs so low in a parking lot. Also, look for signs to hotel parking. The lot is shared between the hotel and a condo next door, and we made the mistake of not reading all the signs to hotel parking before heading in the opposite direction. The other side of the lot was dark and creepy, so use caution when entering the lot. Parking spaces closer to the hotel is well lit, although small. Check-in was quick and hotel staff was friendly. Our room faced Rene Levesque, so we heard some light traffic noise at night. If noise is a concern, I would recommend asking for a room facing away from the street. The room was spacious, with a nice sitting area. Bathroom was clean, and they have Neutrogena bath products available. The hotel is a convenient walk to St. Catherine Street (1 block) where there are many restaurants. We had breakfast at the hotel (buffet $11/person), and it has a nice selection with hot & cold food. Overall, this is a great hotel with very reasonable rates. We were impressed with the room and the hotel in general (I am super picky with cleaniness and I was not dissappointed). This is a great place to stay if you're looking for a comfortable room to unwind after a day of sight-seeing/partying. It's no Ritz Carlton, but it's a great value in Montreal and we'll stay here again the next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: keolo
Reviews.Content: My company booked me at this hotel for a business trip to Montreal last year. The hotel looks like a hybrid between a hotel and residential apartments. It is split in two buildings joined by a tube corridor. Here are the good points: (1) It is in a good location, 1 block from Ste Catherine st. (2) The breakfast in the hotel restaurant was quite good. I don't know if it was good value though because the breakfast came with my room package and I didn't know how much extra it costs. (3) The room was large and clean. Here are the bad points: (1) The fire alarm went off one night about 2AM - there was a fire in the electrical room. I was on one of the top floors. When I went out of my room to go down - there was no emergency lighting whatsoever. I could not even find the EXIT/SORTIE light - it was pitch dark and I tried to feel my way around for about two minutes. I decided to feel my way back to my room when I heard footsteps running down the emergency stairs. I did not know where it is until I saw a flash of light - from the person's flashlight which briefly leaked through the emergency door cracks. I headed in that direction and found the exit door, clambered down very slowly (it was total darkness even in the emergency stairs) until I remembered I had a cellphone which lit the way down for me. If the fire was more serious and there was smoke and panic - I might not have made it. My colleague sent a protest email to the hotel management and all we got back was an unsatisfactory apology. (2) My room's wired internet port does not work and neither does my colleague's in another floor. The wireless worked a bit but I had to work on the floor beside the room's door to get an internet signal. Very uncomfortable. (3) There was a heat wave at that time and I was looking forward to a dip in the pool but didn't because the pool was very small, cramped, and unsightly. After this experience, we sent a recommendation to our company management to not use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Choose a hotel that is more honest and higher in integrity”
Reviews.Author: monacotr8der
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October 2006 and on arrival their staff pushed a trolley off the sidewalk which dented our car. At first they didn't admit to it, but then relented and referred me to the manager Carlos Solomon who simply gave us lip service and wasted immense amounts of our time asking for ridiculous amounts of documentation. The rooms were unimpressive, outdated and just clean enough. In short, after paying for that evening, they refuse to make good on their promise to make the situation right. I would not trust them or recommend anyone else risk the unprofessionalism that we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, tired and very Faded, poor service too.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_Travels
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is a bit stranded on the west side of the city and cabs were needed to get to anywhere of interest. Hotel rooms were adequate, however, the maid service was poor and the room was frequently not made up by the early evening despite leaving room in the early a.m. However, the worst of the situation is that I have had money automatically taken from my bank account after I had departed the country when the account was already settled in full. It has now been several months, and the hotel is refusing to respond to me emails for an explanation, even though I have provided proof of the transactions going through twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so hotel.”
Reviews.Author: abby1of3
Reviews.Content: While looking for a hotel in Montreal to spend part of a romantic anniversary vacation, I ran across the website for Le Nouvel Hotel. They have plain rooms that most of the Trip Advisor reviews talk about but, they also have 5 suites they call "Admiral Lofts." The Lofts have kitchenettes, large Jacuzzi tubs, luxury bedding, and an in-room clothes washer/dryer. The pictures on the website looked impressive so, we booked 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location. Close to restaurants, bars, nightlife, and the metro station. Several restaurants not to miss: Ristorante Ferrari (Italian - amazing fresh pasta and desserts), Upstairs (jazz club with great food), and Vieux Mozart (Austro-Hungarian in the old town area)!!!! Okay, back to the hotel review... The front desk staff was very helpful and relatively easy to communicate with. Don't be intimidated if they start to speak to you in French, they are happy to change to English if you ask (or just look confused). The rooms...wellâ€¦I have mixed feelings. We learned that the 5 Admiral Lofts were recently built in an area connected to the hotel that used to be a comedy club. This in itself was not a problem but, I was surprised to find all the "Lofts" on the 1st floor. I was hoping for a nice city view. Instead, the windows face a walkway (and fence behind the walkway) where people walk back and forth to get to the pool. I can't really fault the hotel for this as it was my assumption that a Loft wouldn't be on the ground floor of a high-rise building. The website didn't say one way or another, and I didn't ask about it in advance...so, I consider this to be my fault for not asking before reserving. However, I wanted to mention it to any others who would find the â€œlack of viewâ€� important. Back to the topic of "new" rooms...we were constantly noticing what a terrible job the contractors did. Baseboard not attached to the wall and bowing out in several places, fan/light above the shower hanging by the electrical wire (we had them fix this while we were there), towel racks and other plumbing fixtures very loose...I could go on but, I'll spare you. It mildly bothered us so see such shabby work but, we didn't allow it to ruin our trip! The nice things about the room were the tall ceilings, very large 2 person Jacuzzi tub, comfortable bed, kitchenette, and laundry machines. We love the local markets and like to cook a few meals in our room when traveling so, the kitchenette was important to us. By the way, if you are a "foodieâ€� -- don't miss the Atwater market!!! Also, the in-room coffee pot doubles as an expresso maker and they give you good quality coffee in the lofts. We cannot comment on the restaurant as we never ate there. Breakfast was included in our room price but we never took advantage of that -- we just aren't breakfast people. We did however, have a glass of wine at the bar and enjoyed talking to the bartender, Victor, who made some great restaurant recommendations. All-in-all, we had a fantastic time...we just loved Montreal! This particular hotel was okay. I think I'd probably stay at the Marriott Residence Inn (in the same neighborhood) next time. I'll miss the nice big Jacuzzi tub but, maybe we'll gain a better view and save some money.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Nouvel Hotel & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 1740 Bld Rene Levesque West, Montreal, Quebec H3H 1R3, Canada
